intro: Urtica hederacea, commonly known as common nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, stinging hairs that cause an irritating rash upon contact with the skin. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with heart-shaped leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in woodland edges, hedgerows, and disturbed areas. Urtica hederacea is a member of the Urticaceae family and is known for its medicinal and historical uses.
